pr_title: Fix memory leak in performance tests

timeline.message:
Fix memory leak in performance tests

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Can we make this configurable? i.e. default to use SummaryStatistics but when desired use DescriptiveStatistics to get the percentiles.
Doesn't have to be DescriptiveStatistics but something that gives us those numbers when we want to get a run with them.
Might be important when we want to get stats on long running tests and see how all users are affected.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Nope, they have different APIs. You can't get median from SummaryStatistics, so what's the point of storing all values otherwise? This is really not worth the effort to add if/else to all the log statements.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
Understandable, maybe we should open a ticket to revisit more memory optimal stats.
I don't like to rely on averages since they can hide issues caused by outliers and by definition aren't what most people experience
replies.author: Nana-EC
